description: Use this Tactic at the start of a battle round. Restore 1 wound and remove 1 flesh wound suffered by your Commander.
title: Apply Field Dressing

description:
Use this Tactic at the beginning of your turn in the
Movement phase. Choose a model from your kill
team (other than a shaken model) that is within 1"
of any enemy models. That model can Advance as
if it had not begun the Movement phase within 1"
of any enemy models.
title: Break Free

description:
Use this Tactic at the end of a battle round. Choose
an objective marker you control. You destroy that
objective marker – remove it from the battlefield.
title: Cause Mayhem

description: Use this Tactic at the end of the Movement phase. Choose an enemy model that is not shaken and is not within 1" of a model from your kill team, and move them 3". You cannot move them through dangerous terrain and you cannot make them jump down. This move does not affect what the model is able to do in this battle round (e.g. if that model was Readied, they are still Readied).
title: Create Distraction

description:
Use this Tactic at the start of the Shooting phase
or Fight phase. For the rest of the phase, you can
re-roll wound rolls of 1 for attacks that target the
enemy Leader.
title: Cut Off The Head

description: Use this Tactic at the end of the battle round. Choose a marked objective that you control, and remove the mark (if you are using Kill Team tokens, flip the token back over).
title: Defuse Charges

description:
Use this Tactic at the end of the battle round,
before determining which player controls which
objectives. Choose a model from your kill team
(other than a shaken model). That model is
considered to be 2 models until the end of the
battle round.
title: Desperate Defender

description: Use this Tactic at the end of a battle round. Choose an objective marker you control. You destroy that objective marker – remove it from the battlefield. You can only use this Tactic once per battle round.
title: Disrupt Supply Line

description: Use this Tactic at the start of the Fight phase. Pick a model from your kill team that is within 1" of an enemy model. That model can be chosen to fight in the Hammer of Wrath section of the Fight phase even if they did not make a charge move.
title: Drive Them Back!

description:
Use this Tactic at the beginning of the Fight phase,
if your Leader is on the battlefield and not shaken.
Until the end of the phase, add 1 to wound rolls for
attacks made by models from your kill team whilst
they are within 3" of your Leader.
title: Finish Them

description: Use this Tactic at the start of the Movement phase. Until the end of the phase, you can re-roll failed charge rolls for your Commander and any friendly models that are within 3" of them when you use this Tactic.
title: Force a Passage!

description:
Use this Tactic when a defender’s model is taken
out of action. Add 1 to the Rampage count. You
can only use this Tactic once per battle round.
title: Gory Spectacle

description: Use this Tactic at the start of the Morale phase. If you do so, friendly models wholly within your deployment zone automatically pass Nerve tests until the end of that phase.
title: Hold Your Ground!

description:
Use this Tactic at the start of the Fight phase
if there are no enemy models within 3" of the
enemy Commander. You can re-roll hit rolls of
1 for attacks that target the enemy Commander
that phase.
title: Isolate and Eliminate

description:
Use this Tactic after declaring a charge with your
Commander. For the rest of the battle round,
roll a D6 each time your Commander suffers
a wound. On a 5+ that wound is not lost. If a
model already has an ability with a similar effect
(such as Disgustingly Resilient), you can choose
which effect applies, and re-roll1s when making
these rolls.
title: Luck Favours The Bold

description:
Use this Tactic at the end of the battle round,
before making any dice rolls as described in
Sabotage. Add 1 to the result of each dice you roll.
You can only use this Tactic once per battle round.
title: Only The Mission Matters

description:
Use this Tactic when a model from your kill team is declared as a target of a charge and is chosen to fire Overwatch. Do not resolve Overwatch with that model as soon as the enemy model declares its charge (other targets of the charge can make Reactions as normal). Instead, the charging model's controlling player makes a charge roll as normal.

If this is insufficient for the charging model to end its move within 1" of the target, no Overwatch attack is made. Otherwise, the charging model's controlling player moves it along a path during which you can interrupt it once, at any point. When you do so, your model fires Overwatch as normal, using the charging model's current location. If the charging model is not taken out of action by this, continue moving the charging model.
title: Point-Blank Overwatch

description:
Use this Tactic at the start of a battle round. Until
the start of the next battle round, objective markers
may not be destroyed whilst within 2" of any of
your models.
title: Protect The Assets

description:
Use this Tactic at the beginning of the Morale
phase. You can subtract 1 from any Nerve tests you
make in this phase.
title: Reinforcements Inbound

description: Use this Tactic at the beginning of the first battle round. Choose one model from your kill team. That model is not affected by the Sentries rule.
title: Rouse Yourselves

description: Use this Tactic at the end of the battle round. Choose an objective that you control, and mark it (if you are using Kill Team tokens, flip the token).
title: Set Charges

description:
Use this Tactic at the start of the Movement phase.
Choose a model from your kill team and roll a D6.
On a 6, that model is removed from the battlefield
and is treated as if it had escaped.
title: Slink Away

description: Use this Tactic at the start of the Fight phase if your Commander made a charge move earlier in the battle round. Add 1 to wound rolls for your Commander's attacks in that phase.
title: Speartip Strike

description:
Use this Tactic at the start of the Shooting phase.
For the rest of the phase, enemy models cannot
target your Leader, unless your Leader is the
closest enemy model that is visible to them.
title: Staying Low

description: Use this Tactic when it is your turn to move in the Movement phase. Your Commander can Advance or attempt to charge this phase.
title: Through Gritted Teeth

description: Use this Tactic at the start of the Morale phase. All friendly models on the battlefield automatically pass Nerve tests.
title: Trophy Kill

description:
Use this Tactic at the end of the Movement phase.
You can choose any number of models from your
kill team that were set up from Reserve in this
battle round. Each of those models can make a
charge attempt, but when they do so you only roll a
D6 (rather than 2D6) for their charge roll.
title: Vengeful Reinforcements

description:
Use this Tactic at the start of the Movement phase.
Choose a model from your kill team that is not
shaken. Enemy models within 1" of this model
cannot Fall Back in this phase.
title: You're Going Nowhere
